tit.cmt: Deleted "(historic pageant)" - as its explained in the following sentence, I don't think it needs an explanation here
NCのコメントに従って括弧内説明を削除しました。

sen.j: 時代行列（じだいぎょうれつ）とは、祭りの中で古墳時代から昭和初期までの時代考証に基づき、各時代の扮装を復元した上で行う行列である。
sen.e: The Jidai Gyoretsu is a historic pageant or procession to demonstrate the clothing which is reproduced based on the historical study of each era of the period of time ranging from the Kofun period (tumulus period) through the early Showa period.

The Jidai Gyoretsu is a pageant or procession in festivals where the participants wear costumes from the Kofun period (tumulus period) through the early Showa period, reproduced after research into each period,

The Jidai Gyoretsu is a pageant or procession in festivals where the participants wear costumes from the Kofun period (tumulus period) through the early Showa period, reproduced after research into each period,

sen.j: 特に近代以降を発祥とする都市祭礼のなかで見られ、戦後に観光業振興のため地域の歴史的資源が着目されて創始された例が多い。
sen.e: Particularly, the Jidai Gyoretsu often takes place in urban festivals which were begun in the modern era, and in many cases, is intended to encourage tourist industries in the postwar era focusing on local historical resources.

Particularly, the Jidai Gyoretsu often takes place in urban festivals, which were begun in the modern era and in many cases, is intended to promote tourism in the postwar era by focusing on local historical resources.

Particularly, the Jidai Gyoretsu often takes place in urban festivals, which were begun in the modern era and in many cases, is intended to promote tourism in the postwar era by focusing on local historical resources.

sen.j: 地域住民を主体とする伝統的祭礼と異なり行政主導である事が多く、宗教的側面が薄く伝統的制約が少ないため集客を目的としたさまざまな趣向が凝らされて華やかなイベントとなる傾向にある。
sen.e: Unlike a traditional festival managed directly by local residents, urban festivals are often initiated by public sectors and tend to become a flamboyant event with various elaborated features aiming to draw crowds since it has few religious characteristics and traditional restrictions.

Unlike a traditional festival managed directly by local residents, urban festivals are often initiated by local governments and, since they have few religious characteristics or traditional restrictions in order to attract crowds, tend to be flamboyant with lots of events.

Unlike a traditional festival managed directly by local residents, urban festivals are often initiated by local governments and, since they have few religious characteristics or traditional restrictions, tend to be flamboyant with lots of events in order to attract crowds.
sen.cmt: in order to attract crowdsがＮＣの文の位置にあると、原文と意味が違ってしまうので最後にもって来ました。

sen.j: 時代行列の内容
sen.e: More information of the Jidai Gyoretsu
More information on the Jidai Gyoretsu
More information on the Jidai Gyoretsu

sen.j: 時代考証についてはかなりしっかりしてるところがある一方で、かなりいいかげんなところも見受けられる。
sen.e: Some of the periodic research seems pretty accurate, but other is likely to be less grounded.
Although at times the research into the costumes is quite in-depth, at others it can be considerably inaccurate.
Although at times the research into the costumes is quite in-depth, at others it can be considerably inaccurate.

sen.j: 古墳時代
sen.e: Kofun period
Kofun period
Kofun period

sen.j: 奈良時代
sen.e: Nara period
Nara period
Nara period

sen.j: 平安時代
sen.e: Heian period
Heian period
Heian period

sen.j: 初期
sen.e: Early Heian period
Early Heian period
Early Heian period

sen.j: 奈良時代と大きく違いはない。
sen.e: It does not greatly differ from the Nara period.
It does not greatly differ from the Nara period.
It does not greatly differ from the Nara period.

sen.j: 中期
sen.e: Mid Heian period
Mid-Heian period
Mid-Heian period

sen.j: 全員が平安装束を着用する。
sen.e: All people wear the Heian costume.
All people wear Heian period costumes.
All people wear Heian period costumes.

sen.j: 但し、若干簡略化される場合が多い。
sen.e: However, the closing is often slightly simplified.
However, the costumes are often slightly simplified.
However, the costumes are often slightly simplified.

sen.j: 曲水の宴も参照。
sen.e: Please refer to the section of Gokusui no En festival.
Please refer to the section on Gokusui no En festival.
Please refer to the section on Gokusui no En festival.

sen.j: 後期
sen.e: Late Heian period
Late Heian period
Late Heian period

sen.j: 平家、そして源氏が台頭した時代、ということから男性は甲冑をまとう場合が多い。
sen.e: Men often put on an armor because it was the period the Taira family and the Minamoto clan evolved.
Men often wear armor because this period saw the rise of the Taira and Minamoto clans.
Men often wear armor because this period saw the rise of the Taira and Minamoto clans.

sen.j: 女性は中期と大きく変わらない。
sen.e: Women's clothing does not greatly differ from the mid Heian period.
Women's clothing does not greatly differ from the mid-Heian period.
Women's clothing does not greatly differ from the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代
sen.e: Kamakura period
Kamakura period
Kamakura period

sen.j: 平安後期と大きく違いはない。
sen.e: The clothing does not greatly differ from the late Heian period.
The clothing does not greatly differ from the late Heian period.
The clothing does not greatly differ from the late Heian period.

sen.j: 室町時代
sen.e: Muromachi period
Muromachi period
Muromachi period

sen.j: 鎌倉時代と大きく違いはない。
sen.e: The clothing does not greatly differ from the Kamakura period.
The clothing does not greatly differ from the Kamakura period.
The clothing does not greatly differ from the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代
sen.e: Azuchi-momoyama period
Azuchi-momoyama period
Azuchi-momoyama period

sen.j: 戦国時代でもあることから男性は武者行列として甲冑をまとう場合が多い。
sen.e: Since it was within the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), men often seem to wear an armor and participate in a samurai procession.
As this was the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), men often wear armor and participate in samurai processions.
As this was the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), men often wear armor and participate in samurai processions.

sen.j: 女性は姫役は平安時代と同様(但し本来は小袖に、小袖の打ち掛けとなる)、それ以外は男性同様に武装した姿の場合が多い。
sen.e: Some women acting as a princess seem to wear clothes similar to the Heian costume (originally, should wear a short-sleeved kimono and uchikake (long garment worn over kimono)) and other often seem to get armored as men do.

Some women dress as princesses in clothes similar to Heian costumes (though authentic costumes would be short-sleeved kimono and uchikake, a long garment worn over kimono) and others wear armor like the men.

Some women dress as princesses in clothes similar to Heian costumes (though authentic costumes would be short-sleeved kimono and uchikake, a long garment worn over kimono) and others wear armor like the men.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo period
Edo period
Edo period

sen.j: 平和な時代を反映して大名行列となる場合が多い。
sen.e: To reflect the peaceful years of the Edo period, feudal lords' procession seems to be often performed.
To reflect the peaceful years of the Edo period, feudal lords' processions are often performed.
To reflect the peaceful years of the Edo period, feudal lords' processions are often performed.

sen.j: 又、姫役、腰元役、町人役、大道芸人役、等の女性や少年少女が登場する場合も多い。
sen.e: Also, women, boys and girls dressed up like a princess, koshimoto (chamber maid), townsman and street performer seem to join the festival.
Also, lots of women, boys and girls dressed as princesses, koshimoto (chamber maids), townspeople and street performers take part in the festival.
Also, lots of women, boys and girls dressed as princesses, koshimoto (chamber maids), townspeople and street performers take part in the festival.

sen.j: 各種の日本髪を観察する絶好の機会。
sen.e: It is the greatest opportunity to take a close look at various Japanese-style hairdos.
It is an ideal opportunity to take a close look at various Japanese hairstyles.
It is an ideal opportunity to take a close look at various Japanese hairstyles.

sen.j: 遊女おいらん道中、丸髷丸髷が見られる祭り等、稚児髷稚児髷が見られる祭り等も参照。
sen.e: Please refer to festivals demonstrating Yujo Oiran Dochu (public procession of licensed courtesans), Marumage (rounded hair style of a married woman) and Chigomage (hair-style for kids)
Please refer to the Yujo Oiran Dochu (public procession of licensed courtesans), Marumage (rounded hairstyle for married women) and Chigomage (hairstyle for children)
Please refer to the Yujo Oiran Dochu (public procession of licensed courtesans), Marumage (rounded hairstyle for married women) and Chigomage (hairstyle for children)

sen.e: Meiji period
Meiji period
Meiji period

sen.j: 大正時代
sen.e: Taisho period
Taisho period
Taisho period

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Other
Other
Other

sen.j: 武将、大名、姫、等の役に芸能人が扮する場合も多い。
sen.e: Professional entertainers seem to wear a costume of warlord, feudal lord, princess, etc. and participate in the festival.
Lots of professional entertainers dress as warlords, daimyo, princesses, etc.
Lots of professional entertainers dress as warlords, daimyo, princesses, etc.

sen.j: 上記の行列の中に巫女、稚児、手古舞、民謡舞踊、御輿、鼓笛隊、バトンガール、カラーガード等が入る場合も多い。
sen.e: Female attendants, children, Tekomai dancers (Japanese traditional dance), local folk song dances, omikoshi (portable shrine), brass bands, baton twirlers and color guards are likely to join the procession described above.

Shrine maidens, children, traditional Tekomai dancers, local folk song dancers, omikoshi (portable shrines), brass bands, baton twirlers and color guards also often take part in the procession described above.

Shrine maidens, children, traditional Tekomai dancers, local folk song dancers, omikoshi (portable shrines), brass bands, baton twirlers and color guards also often take part in the procession described above.
